alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Union (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 8:08AM MDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Rock River at Luverne affecting Rock County. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Union, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River above Hawarden. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, some farm houses on the South Dakota side of the river are isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 21.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Monday was 21.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.3 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall early Thursday morning. It will rise to 24.4 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Big Sioux River Hawarden 20.5 21.3 Mon 8 am 24.1 24.3 24.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
